intro: Xanthoxalis breviramulosa, commonly known as the short-stemmed goldencup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in the summer months. Xanthoxalis breviramulosa is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
